page.title: 08ECOLOGY OF DEERNESS
page.content: The proximity of Deerness to the sea affects plant life to the extent that trees do not grow except in sheltered spots.{Wild flowers} abound. Heather is almost non-existant owing to land reclamation and heavy manuring. Some marshy spots have been drained to the detriment of moisture-loving plants. {Birds of land and coast}are abundant. Nesting places of some have changed owing to the cultivation of virgin heath. An eastern exposure makes this a favourite spot for{migrating birds and many make landfall here in strong easterly winds.{Hares, rabbits and {hedgehogs}are often killed by passing vehicles.{Small rodents}have few natural predators as hawks and owls are seldom seen. Because of strong winds we have{no pollution.}Petrol fumes or smoke blow away leaving a clean, healthy environment.
